meanings.definition: Strong wire with barbs at regular intervals used to make fences.
meanings.sent1: The farmer put up barbwire to keep the cows safe in the field.
meanings.sent2: The old barn was surrounded by barbwire to protect it from intruders.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to jump over the barbwire fence but got stuck!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sharp barbwire, hurting his feelings deeply.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the barbwire in the sunlight made the fence look menacing.

meanings.definition: To enclose or divide with barbwire.
meanings.sent1: The workers will barbwire the construction site for safety.
meanings.sent2: They decided to barbwire the garden to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent3: He tried to barbwire his toys away from his little brother, but he still found them!
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room seemed to barbwire them apart, creating a divide.
meanings.sent5: She felt like someone had barbwired her heart, making it hard to trust again.
